013package org.apache.juneau.reflect;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.map;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
019
020import java.lang.annotation.*;
021import java.lang.reflect.*;
022import java.util.*;
023import java.util.concurrent.*;
024import java.util.function.*;
025
026import org.apache.juneau.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
029
030/**
031 * Lightweight utility class for introspecting information about a class.
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * Provides various convenience methods for introspecting fields/methods/annotations
035 * that aren't provided by the standard Java reflection APIs.
036 *
037 * <p>
038 * Objects are designed to be lightweight to create and threadsafe.
039 *
040 * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
041 * <p class='bjava'>
042 *    <jc>// Wrap our class inside a ClassInfo.</jc>
043 *    ClassInfo <jv>classInfo</jv> = ClassInfo.<jsm>of</jsm>(MyClass.<jk>class</jk>);
044 *
045 *    <jc>// Get all methods in parent-to-child order, sorted alphabetically per class.</jc>
046 *    <jk>for</jk> (MethodInfo <jv>methodInfo</jv> : <jv>classInfo</jv>.getAllMethods()) {
047 *       <jc>// Do something with it.</jc>
048 *    }
049 *
050 *    <jc>// Get all class-level annotations in parent-to-child order.</jc>
051 *    <jk>for</jk> (MyAnnotation <jv>annotation</jv> : <jv>classInfo</jv>.getAnnotations(MyAnnotation.<jk>class</jk>)) {
052 *       <jc>// Do something with it.</jc>
053 *    }
054 * </p>
055 *
056 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
057 * </ul>
058 */
059public class ClassInfo {
060
061   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
062   // Static
063   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
064
065   private static final Map<Class<?>,ClassInfo> CACHE = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
066
067   /** Reusable ClassInfo for Object class. */
068   public static final ClassInfo OBJECT = ClassInfo.of(Object.class);
069
070   /**
071    * Returns a class info wrapper around the specified class type.
072    *
073    * @param t The class type.
074    * @return The constructed class info, or <jk>null</jk> if the type was <jk>null</jk>.
075    */
076   public static ClassInfo of(Type t) {
077      if (t == null)
078         return null;
079      if (t instanceof Class)
080         return of((Class<?>)t);
081      return new ClassInfo(ClassUtils.toClass(t), t);
082   }
083
084   /**
085    * Returns a class info wrapper around the specified class type.
086    *
087    * @param c The class type.
088    * @return The constructed class info, or <jk>null</jk> if the type was <jk>null</jk>.
089    */
090   public static ClassInfo of(Class<?> c) {
091      if (c == null)
092         return null;
093      ClassInfo ci = CACHE.get(c);
094      if (ci == null) {
095         ci = new ClassInfo(c, c);
096         CACHE.put(c, ci);
097      }
098      return ci;
099   }
100
101   /**
102    * Returns a class info wrapper around the specified class type.
103    *
104    * @param c The class type.
105    * @param t The generic type (if parameterized type).
106    * @return The constructed class info, or <jk>null</jk> if the type was <jk>null</jk>.
107    */
108   public static ClassInfo of(Class<?> c, Type t) {
109      if (c == t)
110         return of(c);
111      return new ClassInfo(c, t);
112   }
113
114   /**
115    * Same as using the constructor, but operates on an object instance.
116    *
117    * @param o The class instance.
118    * @return The constructed class info, or <jk>null</jk> if the object was <jk>null</jk>.
119    */
120   public static ClassInfo of(Object o) {
121      return of(o == null ? null : o instanceof Class ? (Class<?>)o : o.getClass());
122   }
123
124   /**
125    * Same as {@link #of(Object)} but attempts to deproxify the object if it's wrapped in a CGLIB proxy.
126    *
127    * @param o The class instance.
128    * @return The constructed class info, or <jk>null</jk> if the object was <jk>null</jk>.
129    */
130   public static ClassInfo ofProxy(Object o) {
131      if (o == null)
132         return null;
133      Class<?> c = getProxyFor(o);
134      return c == null ? ClassInfo.of(o) : ClassInfo.of(c);
135   }
136
137   /**
138    * When this metadata is against a CGLIB proxy, this method finds the underlying "real" class.
139    *
140    * @param o The class instance.
141    * @return The non-proxy class, or <jk>null</jk> if it's not a CGLIB proxy.
142    */
143   private static Class<?> getProxyFor(Object o) {
144      Class<?> c = o.getClass();
145      String s = c.getName();
146      if (s.indexOf('$') == -1 || ! s.contains("$$EnhancerBySpringCGLIB$$"))
147         return null;
148      Value<Class<?>> v = Value.empty();
149      ClassInfo.of(c).forEachPublicMethod(
150         m -> m.hasName("getTargetClass") && m.hasNoParams() && m.hasReturnType(Class.class),
151         m -> safe(() -> v.set(m.invoke(o)))
152      );
153      return v.orElse(null);
154   }
155
156   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
157   // Instance
158   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
159
160   private final Type t;
161   final Class<?> c;
162   private final boolean isParameterizedType;
163   private volatile Boolean isRepeatedAnnotation;
164   private volatile ClassInfo[] interfaces, declaredInterfaces, parents, allParents;
165   private volatile MethodInfo[] publicMethods, declaredMethods, allMethods, allMethodsParentFirst;
166   private volatile MethodInfo repeatedAnnotationMethod;
167   private volatile ConstructorInfo[] publicConstructors, declaredConstructors;
168   private volatile FieldInfo[] publicFields, declaredFields, allFields;
169   private volatile Annotation[] declaredAnnotations;
170   private int dim = -1;
171   private ClassInfo componentType;
172
173   private final ConcurrentHashMap<Method,MethodInfo> methods = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
174   private final ConcurrentHashMap<Field,FieldInfo> fields = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
175   private final ConcurrentHashMap<Constructor<?>,ConstructorInfo> constructors = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
176
177   /**
178    * Constructor.
179    *
180    * @param c The class type.
181    * @param t The generic type (if parameterized type).
182    */
183   protected ClassInfo(Class<?> c, Type t) {
184      this.t = t;
185      this.c = c;
186      this.isParameterizedType = t == null ? false : (t instanceof ParameterizedType);
187   }
188
189   /**
190    * Returns the wrapped class as a {@link Type}.
191    *
192    * @return The wrapped class as a {@link Type}.
193    */
194   public Type innerType() {
195      return t;
196   }
197
198   /**
199    * Returns the wrapped class as a {@link Class}.
200    *
201    * @param <T> The inner class type.
202    * @return The wrapped class as a {@link Class}, or <jk>null</jk> if it's not a class (e.g. it's a {@link ParameterizedType}).
203    */
204   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
205   public <T> Class<T> inner() {
206      return (Class<T>)c;
207   }
208
209   /**
210    * Unwrap this class if it's a parameterized type of the specified type such as {@link Value} or {@link Optional}.
211    *
212    * @param wrapperTypes The parameterized types to unwrap if this class is one of those types.
213    * @return The class info on the unwrapped type, or just this type if this isn't one of the specified types.
214    */
215   public ClassInfo unwrap(Class<?>...wrapperTypes) {
216      for (Class<?> wt : wrapperTypes) {
217         if (isParameterizedTypeOf(wt)) {
218            Type t = getFirstParameterType(wt);
219            if (t != null)
220               return of(t).unwrap(wrapperTypes); // Recursively do it again.
221         }
222      }
223      return this;
224   }
225
226   private boolean isParameterizedTypeOf(Class<?> c) {
227      return
228         (t instanceof ParameterizedType && ((ParameterizedType)t).getRawType() == c)
229         || (t instanceof Class && c.isAssignableFrom((Class<?>)t));
230   }
231
232   private Type getFirstParameterType(Class<?> parameterizedType) {
233      if (t instanceof ParameterizedType) {
234         ParameterizedType pt = (ParameterizedType)t;
235         Type[] ta = pt.getActualTypeArguments();
236         if (ta.length > 0)
237            return ta[0];
238      } else if (t instanceof Class) /* Class that extends Optional<T> */ {
239         Class<?> c = (Class<?>)t;
240         if (c != parameterizedType && parameterizedType.isAssignableFrom(c))
241            return ClassInfo.of(c).getParameterType(0, parameterizedType);
242      }
243      return null;
244   }
245
246   MethodInfo getMethodInfo(Method x) {
247      MethodInfo i = methods.get(x);
248      if (i == null) {
249         i = new MethodInfo(this, x);
250         methods.put(x, i);
251      }
252      return i;
253   }
254
255   FieldInfo getFieldInfo(Field x) {
256      FieldInfo i = fields.get(x);
257      if (i == null) {
258         i = new FieldInfo(this, x);
259         fields.put(x, i);
260      }
261      return i;
262   }
263
264   ConstructorInfo getConstructorInfo(Constructor<?> x) {
265      ConstructorInfo i = constructors.get(x);
266      if (i == null) {
267         i = new ConstructorInfo(this, x);
268         constructors.put(x, i);
269      }
270      return i;
271   }
272
273   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
274   // Parent classes and interfaces.
275   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
276
277   /**
278    * Returns the parent class.
279    *
280    * @return
281    *    The parent class, or <jk>null</jk> if the class has no parent.
282    */
283   public ClassInfo getSuperclass() {
284      return c == null ? null : of(c.getSuperclass());
285   }
286
287   /**
288    * Returns a list of interfaces declared on this class.
289    *
290    * <p>
291    * Does not include interfaces declared on parent classes.
292    *
293    * <p>
294    * Results are in the same order as Class.getInterfaces().
295    *
296    * @return
297    *    An unmodifiable list of interfaces declared on this class.
298    *    <br>Results are in the same order as {@link Class#getInterfaces()}.
299    */
300   public List<ClassInfo> getDeclaredInterfaces() {
301      return u(alist(_getDeclaredInterfaces()));
302   }
303
304   /**
305    * Returns a list of interfaces defined on this class and superclasses.
306    *
307    * <p>
308    * Results are in child-to-parent order.
309    *
310    * @return
311    *    An unmodifiable list of interfaces defined on this class and superclasses.
312    *    <br>Results are in child-to-parent order.
313    */
314   public List<ClassInfo> getInterfaces() {
315      return u(alist(_getInterfaces()));
316   }
317
318   /**
319    * Returns a list including this class and all parent classes.
320    *
321    * <p>
322    * Does not include interfaces.
323    *
324    * <p>
325    * Results are in child-to-parent order.
326    *
327    * @return An unmodifiable list including this class and all parent classes.
328    *    <br>Results are in child-to-parent order.
329    */
330   public List<ClassInfo> getParents() {
331      return u(alist(_getParents()));
332   }
333
334   /**
335    * Returns a list including this class and all parent classes and interfaces.
336    *
337    * <p>
338    * Results are classes-before-interfaces, then child-to-parent order.
339    *
340    * @return An unmodifiable list including this class and all parent classes.
341    *    <br>Results are ordered child-to-parent order with classes listed before interfaces.
342    */
343   public List<ClassInfo> getAllParents() {
344      return u(alist(_getAllParents()));
345   }
346
347   /**
348    * Returns the first matching parent class or interface.
349    *
350    * <p>
351    * Results are classes-before-interfaces, then child-to-parent order.
352    *
353    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
354    * @return The parent class or interface that matches the specified predicate.
355    */
356   public ClassInfo getAnyParent(Predicate<ClassInfo> filter) {
357      for (ClassInfo ci : _getAllParents())
358         if (test(filter, ci))
359            return ci;
360      return null;
361   }
362
363   /** Results are in child-to-parent order. */
364   ClassInfo[] _getInterfaces() {
365      if (interfaces == null) {
366         synchronized(this) {
367            Set<ClassInfo> s = set();
368            for (ClassInfo ci : _getParents())
369               for (ClassInfo ci2 : ci._getDeclaredInterfaces()) {
370                  s.add(ci2);
371                  for (ClassInfo ci3 : ci2._getInterfaces())
372                     s.add(ci3);
373               }
374            interfaces = s.toArray(new ClassInfo[s.size()]);
375         }
376      }
377      return interfaces;
378   }
379
380   /** Results are in the same order as Class.getInterfaces(). */
381   ClassInfo[] _getDeclaredInterfaces() {
382      if (declaredInterfaces == null) {
383         synchronized(this) {
384            Class<?>[] ii = c == null ? new Class[0] : c.getInterfaces();
385            ClassInfo[] l = new ClassInfo[ii.length];
386            for (int i = 0; i < ii.length; i++)
387               l[i] = of(ii[i]);
388            declaredInterfaces = l;
389         }
390      }
391      return declaredInterfaces;
392   }
393
394   /** Results are in child-to-parent order. */
395   ClassInfo[] _getParents() {
396      if (parents == null) {
397         synchronized(this) {
398            List<ClassInfo> l = list();
399            Class<?> pc = c;
400            while (pc != null && pc != Object.class) {
401               l.add(of(pc));
402               pc = pc.getSuperclass();
403            }
404            parents = l.toArray(new ClassInfo[l.size()]);
405         }
406      }
407      return parents;
408   }
409
410   /** Results are classes-before-interfaces, then child-to-parent order. */
411   ClassInfo[] _getAllParents() {
412      if (allParents == null) {
413         synchronized(this) {
414            ClassInfo[] a1 = _getParents(), a2 = _getInterfaces();
415            ClassInfo[] l = new ClassInfo[a1.length + a2.length];
416            for (int i = 0; i < a1.length; i++)
417               l[i] = a1[i];
418            for (int i = 0; i < a2.length; i++)
419               l[i+a1.length] = a2[i];
420            allParents = l;
421         }
422      }
423      return allParents;
424   }
425
426   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
427   // Methods
428   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
429
430   /**
431    * Returns all public methods on this class.
432    *
433    * <p>
434    * Methods defined on the {@link Object} class are excluded from the results.
435    *
436    * @return
437    *    All public methods on this class.
438    *    <br>Results are ordered alphabetically.
439    */
440   public List<MethodInfo> getPublicMethods() {
441      return u(alist(_getPublicMethods()));
442   }
443
444   /**
445    * Performs an action on all matching public methods on this class.
446    *
447    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
448    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
449    * @return This object.
450    */
451   public ClassInfo forEachPublicMethod(Predicate<MethodInfo> filter, Consumer<MethodInfo> action) {
452      for (MethodInfo mi : _getPublicMethods())
453         consume(filter, action, mi);
454      return this;
455   }
456
457   /**
458    * Returns the first matching public method on this class.
459    *
460    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
461    * @return The first matching method, or <jk>null</jk> if no methods matched.
462    */
463   public MethodInfo getPublicMethod(Predicate<MethodInfo> filter) {
464      for (MethodInfo mi : _getPublicMethods())
465         if (test(filter, mi))
466            return mi;
467      return null;
468   }
469
470   /**
471    * Returns all methods declared on this class.
472    *
473    * @return
474    *    All methods declared on this class.
475    *    <br>Results are ordered alphabetically.
476    *    <br>List is unmodifiable.
477    */
478   public List<MethodInfo> getDeclaredMethods() {
479      return u(alist(_getDeclaredMethods()));
480   }
481
482   /**
483    * Performs an action on all matching declared methods on this class.
484    *
485    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
486    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
487    * @return This object.
488    */
489   public ClassInfo forEachDeclaredMethod(Predicate<MethodInfo> filter, Consumer<MethodInfo> action) {
490      for (MethodInfo mi : _getDeclaredMethods())
491         consume(filter, action, mi);
492      return this;
493   }
494
495   /**
496    * Returns the first matching declared method on this class.
497    *
498    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
499    * @return The first matching method, or <jk>null</jk> if no methods matched.
500    */
501   public MethodInfo getDeclaredMethod(Predicate<MethodInfo> filter) {
502      for (MethodInfo mi : _getDeclaredMethods())
503         if (test(filter, mi))
504            return mi;
505      return null;
506   }
507
508   /**
509    * Returns all declared methods on this class and all parent classes.
510    *
511    * @return
512    *    All declared methods on this class and all parent classes.
513    *    <br>Results are ordered child-to-parent, and then alphabetically per class.
514    *    <br>List is unmodifiable.
515    */
516   public List<MethodInfo> getMethods() {
517      return u(alist(_getAllMethods()));
518   }
519
520   /**
521    * Performs an action on all matching methods on this class.
522    *
523    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
524    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
525    * @return This object.
526    */
527   public ClassInfo forEachMethod(Predicate<MethodInfo> filter, Consumer<MethodInfo> action) {
528      for (MethodInfo mi : _getAllMethods())
529         consume(filter, action, mi);
530      return this;
531   }
532
533   /**
534    * Returns the first matching method on this class.
535    *
536    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
537    * @return The first matching method, or <jk>null</jk> if no methods matched.
538    */
539   public MethodInfo getMethod(Predicate<MethodInfo> filter) {
540      for (MethodInfo mi : _getAllMethods())
541         if (test(filter, mi))
542            return mi;
543      return null;
544   }
545
546   /**
547    * Returns all declared methods on this class and all parent classes.
548    *
549    * @return
550    *    All declared methods on this class and all parent classes.
551    *    <br>Results are ordered parent-to-child, and then alphabetically per class.
552    *    <br>List is unmodifiable.
553    */
554   public List<MethodInfo> getAllMethodsParentFirst() {
555      return u(alist(_getAllMethodsParentFirst()));
556   }
557
558   /**
559    * Performs an action on all matching declared methods on this class and all parent classes.
560    *
561    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
562    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
563    * @return This object.
564    */
565   public ClassInfo forEachAllMethodParentFirst(Predicate<MethodInfo> filter, Consumer<MethodInfo> action) {
566      for (MethodInfo mi : _getAllMethodsParentFirst())
567         consume(filter, action, mi);
568      return this;
569   }
570
571   MethodInfo[] _getPublicMethods() {
572      if (publicMethods == null) {
573         synchronized(this) {
574            Method[] mm = c == null ? new Method[0] : c.getMethods();
575            List<MethodInfo> l = Utils.listOfSize(mm.length);
576            for (Method m : mm)
577               if (m.getDeclaringClass() != Object.class)
578                  l.add(getMethodInfo(m));
579            l.sort(null);
580            publicMethods = l.toArray(new MethodInfo[l.size()]);
581         }
582      }
583      return publicMethods;
584   }
585
586   MethodInfo[] _getDeclaredMethods() {
587      if (declaredMethods == null) {
588         synchronized(this) {
589            Method[] mm = c == null ? new Method[0] : c.getDeclaredMethods();
590            List<MethodInfo> l = Utils.listOfSize(mm.length);
591            for (Method m : mm)
592               if (! "$jacocoInit".equals(m.getName())) // Jacoco adds its own simulated methods.
593                  l.add(getMethodInfo(m));
594            l.sort(null);
595            declaredMethods = l.toArray(new MethodInfo[l.size()]);
596         }
597      }
598      return declaredMethods;
599   }
600
601   MethodInfo[] _getAllMethods() {
602      if (allMethods == null) {
603         synchronized(this) {
604            List<MethodInfo> l = list();
605            for (ClassInfo c : _getAllParents())
606               c._appendDeclaredMethods(l);
607            allMethods = l.toArray(new MethodInfo[l.size()]);
608         }
609      }
610      return allMethods;
611   }
612
613   MethodInfo[] _getAllMethodsParentFirst() {
614      if (allMethodsParentFirst == null) {
615         synchronized(this) {
616            List<MethodInfo> l = list();
617            ClassInfo[] parents = _getAllParents();
618            for (int i = parents.length-1; i >=0; i--)
619               parents[i]._appendDeclaredMethods(l);
620            allMethodsParentFirst = l.toArray(new MethodInfo[l.size()]);
621         }
622      }
623      return allMethodsParentFirst;
624   }
625
626   private synchronized List<MethodInfo> _appendDeclaredMethods(List<MethodInfo> l) {
627      for (MethodInfo mi : _getDeclaredMethods())
628         l.add(mi);
629      return l;
630   }
631
632   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
633   // Constructors
634   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
635
636   /**
637    * Returns all the public constructors defined on this class.
638    *
639    * @return All public constructors defined on this class.
640    */
641   public List<ConstructorInfo> getPublicConstructors() {
642      return u(alist(_getPublicConstructors()));
643   }
644
645   /**
646    * Performs an action on all matching public constructors on this class.
647    *
648    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
649    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
650    * @return This object.
651    */
652   public ClassInfo forEachPublicConstructor(Predicate<ConstructorInfo> filter, Consumer<ConstructorInfo> action) {
653      for (ConstructorInfo mi : _getPublicConstructors())
654         consume(filter, action, mi);
655      return this;
656   }
657
658   /**
659    * Returns the first matching public constructor on this class.
660    *
661    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
662    * @return The public constructor that matches the specified predicate.
663    */
664   public ConstructorInfo getPublicConstructor(Predicate<ConstructorInfo> filter) {
665      for (ConstructorInfo ci : _getPublicConstructors())
666         if (test(filter, ci))
667            return ci;
668      return null;
669   }
670
671   /**
672    * Returns all the constructors defined on this class.
673    *
674    * @return
675    *    All constructors defined on this class.
676    *    <br>List is unmodifiable.
677    */
678   public List<ConstructorInfo> getDeclaredConstructors() {
679      return u(alist(_getDeclaredConstructors()));
680   }
681
682   /**
683    * Performs an action on all matching declared constructors on this class.
684    *
685    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
686    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
687    * @return This object.
688    */
689   public ClassInfo forEachDeclaredConstructor(Predicate<ConstructorInfo> filter, Consumer<ConstructorInfo> action) {
690      for (ConstructorInfo mi : _getDeclaredConstructors())
691         consume(filter, action, mi);
692      return this;
693   }
694
695   /**
696    * Returns the first matching declared constructor on this class.
697    *
698    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
699    * @return The declared constructor that matches the specified predicate.
700    */
701   public ConstructorInfo getDeclaredConstructor(Predicate<ConstructorInfo> filter) {
702      for (ConstructorInfo ci : _getDeclaredConstructors())
703         if (test(filter, ci))
704            return ci;
705      return null;
706   }
707
708   ConstructorInfo[] _getPublicConstructors() {
709      if (publicConstructors == null) {
710         synchronized(this) {
711            Constructor<?>[] cc = c == null ? new Constructor[0] : c.getConstructors();
712            List<ConstructorInfo> l = Utils.listOfSize(cc.length);
713            for (Constructor<?> ccc : cc)
714               l.add(getConstructorInfo(ccc));
715            l.sort(null);
716            publicConstructors = l.toArray(new ConstructorInfo[l.size()]);
717         }
718      }
719      return publicConstructors;
720   }
721
722   ConstructorInfo[] _getDeclaredConstructors() {
723      if (declaredConstructors == null) {
724         synchronized(this) {
725            Constructor<?>[] cc = c == null ? new Constructor[0] : c.getDeclaredConstructors();
726            List<ConstructorInfo> l = Utils.listOfSize(cc.length);
727            for (Constructor<?> ccc : cc)
728               l.add(getConstructorInfo(ccc));
729            l.sort(null);
730            declaredConstructors = l.toArray(new ConstructorInfo[l.size()]);
731         }
732      }
733      return declaredConstructors;
734   }
735
736   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
737   // Special constructors
738   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
739
740   /**
741    * Locates the no-arg constructor for this class.
742    *
743    * <p>
744    * Constructor must match the visibility requirements specified by parameter 'v'.
745    * If class is abstract, always returns <jk>null</jk>.
746    * Note that this also returns the 1-arg constructor for non-static member classes.
747    *
748    * @param v The minimum visibility.
749    * @return The constructor, or <jk>null</jk> if no no-arg constructor exists with the required visibility.
750    */
751   public ConstructorInfo getNoArgConstructor(Visibility v) {
752      if (isAbstract())
753         return null;
754      boolean isMemberClass = isNonStaticMemberClass();
755      for (ConstructorInfo cc : _getDeclaredConstructors())
756         if (cc.hasNumParams(isMemberClass ? 1 : 0) && cc.isVisible(v))
757            return cc.accessible(v);
758      return null;
759   }

765   /**
766    * Returns all public fields on this class.
767    *
768    * <p>
769    * Hidden fields are excluded from the results.
770    *
771    * @return
772    *    All public fields on this class.
773    *    <br>Results are in alphabetical order.
774    *    <br>List is unmodifiable.
775    */
776   public List<FieldInfo> getPublicFields() {
777      return u(alist(_getPublicFields()));
778   }
779
780   /**
781    * Performs an action on all matching public fields on this class.
782    *
783    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
784    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
785    * @return This object.
786    */
787   public ClassInfo forEachPublicField(Predicate<FieldInfo> filter, Consumer<FieldInfo> action) {
788      for (FieldInfo mi : _getPublicFields())
789         consume(filter, action, mi);
790      return this;
791   }
792
793   /**
794    * Returns the first matching public field on this class.
795    *
796    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
797    * @return The public field, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
798    */
799   public FieldInfo getPublicField(Predicate<FieldInfo> filter) {
800      for (FieldInfo f : _getPublicFields())
801         if (test(filter, f))
802            return f;
803      return null;
804   }
805
806   /**
807    * Returns all declared fields on this class.
808    *
809    * @return
810    *    All declared fields on this class.
811    *    <br>Results are in alphabetical order.
812    *    <br>List is unmodifiable.
813    */
814   public List<FieldInfo> getDeclaredFields() {
815      return u(alist(_getDeclaredFields()));
816   }
817
818   /**
819    * Performs an action on all matching declared fields on this class.
820    *
821    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
822    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
823    * @return This object.
824    */
825   public ClassInfo forEachDeclaredField(Predicate<FieldInfo> filter, Consumer<FieldInfo> action) {
826      for (FieldInfo fi : _getDeclaredFields())
827         consume(filter, action, fi);
828      return this;
829   }
830
831   /**
832    * Returns the first matching declared field on this class.
833    *
834    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
835    * @return The declared field, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
836    */
837   public FieldInfo getDeclaredField(Predicate<FieldInfo> filter) {
838      for (FieldInfo f : _getDeclaredFields())
839         if (test(filter, f))
840            return f;
841      return null;
842   }

844   /**
845    * Returns all fields on this class and all parent classes.
846    *
847    * <p>
848    *    Results are ordered parent-to-child, and then alphabetical per class.
849    *
850    * @return
851    *    All declared fields on this class.
852    *    <br>List is unmodifiable.
853    */
854   public List<FieldInfo> getAllFields() {
855      return u(alist(_getAllFields()));
856   }
857
858   /**
859    * Performs an action on all matching fields on this class and all parent classes.
860    *
861    * <p>
862    *    Results are ordered parent-to-child, and then alphabetical per class.
863    *
864    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
865    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
866    * @return This object.
867    */
868   public ClassInfo forEachAllField(Predicate<FieldInfo> filter, Consumer<FieldInfo> action) {
869      for (FieldInfo fi : _getAllFields())
870         consume(filter, action, fi);
871      return this;
872   }
873
874   FieldInfo[] _getPublicFields() {
875      if (publicFields == null) {
876         synchronized(this) {
877            Map<String,FieldInfo> m = map();
878            for (ClassInfo c : _getParents()) {
879               for (FieldInfo f : c._getDeclaredFields()) {
880                  String fn = f.getName();
881                  if (f.isPublic() && ! (m.containsKey(fn) || "$jacocoData".equals(fn)))
882                     m.put(f.getName(), f);
883               }
884            }
885            List<FieldInfo> l = listFrom(m.values());
886            l.sort(null);
887            publicFields = l.toArray(new FieldInfo[l.size()]);
888         }
889      }
890      return publicFields;
891   }
892
893   FieldInfo[] _getDeclaredFields() {
894      if (declaredFields == null) {
895         synchronized(this) {
896            Field[] ff = c == null ? new Field[0] : c.getDeclaredFields();
897            List<FieldInfo> l = Utils.listOfSize(ff.length);
898            for (Field f : ff)
899               if (! "$jacocoData".equals(f.getName()))
900                  l.add(getFieldInfo(f));
901            l.sort(null);
902            declaredFields = l.toArray(new FieldInfo[l.size()]);
903         }
904      }
905      return declaredFields;
906   }
907
908   FieldInfo[] _getAllFields() {
909      if (allFields == null) {
910         synchronized(this) {
911            List<FieldInfo> l = list();
912            ClassInfo[] parents = _getAllParents();
913            for (int i = parents.length-1; i >=0; i--)
914               for (FieldInfo f : parents[i]._getDeclaredFields())
915                  l.add(f);
916            allFields = l.toArray(new FieldInfo[l.size()]);
917         }
918      }
919      return allFields;
920   }

926   /**
927    * Returns all annotations of the specified type defined on the specified class or parent classes/interfaces in parent-to-child order.
928    *
929    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
930    * @param type The annotation type to look for.
931    * @return The matching annotations.
932    */
933   public <A extends Annotation> List<A> getAnnotations(Class<A> type) {
934      return getAnnotations(null, type);
935   }
936
937   /**
938    * Returns all annotations of the specified type defined on this or parent classes/interfaces.
939    *
940    * <p>
941    * Returns the list in reverse (parent-to-child) order.
942    *
943    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
944    * @param annotationProvider The annotation provider.
945    * @param type The annotation type to look for.
946    * @return The matching annotations.
947    */
948   public <A extends Annotation> List<A> getAnnotations(AnnotationProvider annotationProvider, Class<A> type) {
949      List<A> l = list();
950      forEachAnnotation(annotationProvider, type, x-> true, x -> l.add(x));
951      return l;
952   }
953
954   /**
955    * Performs an action on all matching annotations on this class and superclasses/interfaces.
956    *
957    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
958    * @param type The annotation to look for.
959    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
960    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
961    * @return This object.
962    */
963   public <A extends Annotation> ClassInfo forEachAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter, Consumer<A> action) {
964      return forEachAnnotation(null, type, filter, action);
965   }
966
967   /**
968    * Performs an action on all matching annotations on this class and superclasses/interfaces.
969    *
970    * <p>
971    * Annotations are appended in the following orders:
972    * <ol>
973    *    <li>On the package of this class.
974    *    <li>On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
975    *    <li>On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
976    *    <li>On this class.
977    * </ol>
978    *
979    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
980    * @param annotationProvider The annotation provider.
981    * @param type The annotation to look for.
982    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
983    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
984    * @return This object.
985    */
986   public <A extends Annotation> ClassInfo forEachAnnotation(AnnotationProvider annotationProvider, Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter, Consumer<A> action) {
987      if (annotationProvider == null)
988         annotationProvider = AnnotationProvider.DEFAULT;
989      A t2 = getPackageAnnotation(type);
990      if (t2 != null)
991         consume(filter, action, t2);
992      ClassInfo[] interfaces = _getInterfaces();
993      for (int i = interfaces.length-1; i >= 0; i--)
994         annotationProvider.forEachDeclaredAnnotation(type, interfaces[i].inner(), filter, action);
995      ClassInfo[] parents = _getParents();
996      for (int i = parents.length-1; i >= 0; i--)
997         annotationProvider.forEachDeclaredAnnotation(type, parents[i].inner(), filter, action);
998      return this;
999   }
1000
1001   /**
1002    * Returns the first matching annotation on this class and superclasses/interfaces.
1003    *
1004    * <p>
1005    * Annotations are searched in the following orders:
1006    * <ol>
1007    *    <li>On the package of this class.
1008    *    <li>On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
1009    *    <li>On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
1010    *    <li>On this class.
1011    * </ol>
1012    *
1013    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1014    * @param type The annotation to look for.
1015    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if annotation should be returned.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1016    * @return This object.
1017    */
1018   public <A extends Annotation> A firstAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter) {
1019      return firstAnnotation(null, type, filter);
1020   }
1021
1022   /**
1023    * Returns the first matching annotation on this class and superclasses/interfaces.
1024    *
1025    * <p>
1026    * Annotations are searched in the following orders:
1027    * <ol>
1028    *    <li>On the package of this class.
1029    *    <li>On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
1030    *    <li>On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
1031    *    <li>On this class.
1032    * </ol>
1033    *
1034    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1035    * @param annotationProvider The annotation provider.
1036    * @param type The annotation to look for.
1037    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if annotation should be returned.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1038    * @return This object.
1039    */
1040   public <A extends Annotation> A firstAnnotation(AnnotationProvider annotationProvider, Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter) {
1041      if (annotationProvider == null)
1042         annotationProvider = AnnotationProvider.DEFAULT;
1043      A x = null;
1044      x = getPackageAnnotation(type);
1045      if (x != null && test(filter, x))
1046         return x;
1047      ClassInfo[] interfaces = _getInterfaces();
1048      for (int i = interfaces.length-1; i >= 0; i--) {
1049         x = annotationProvider.firstAnnotation(type, interfaces[i].inner(), filter);
1050         if (x != null)
1051            return x;
1052      }
1053      ClassInfo[] parents = _getParents();
1054      for (int i = parents.length-1; i >= 0; i--) {
1055         x = annotationProvider.firstAnnotation(type, parents[i].inner(), filter);
1056         if (x != null)
1057            return x;
1058      }
1059      return null;
1060   }
1061
1062   /**
1063    * Returns the last matching annotation on this class and superclasses/interfaces.
1064    *
1065    * <p>
1066    * Annotations are searched in the following orders:
1067    * <ol>
1068    *    <li>On this class.
1069    *    <li>On parent classes ordered child-to-parent.
1070    *    <li>On interfaces ordered child-to-parent.
1071    *    <li>On the package of this class.
1072    * </ol>
1073    *
1074    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1075    * @param type The annotation to look for.
1076    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if annotation should be returned.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1077    * @return This object.
1078    */
1079   public <A extends Annotation> A lastAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter) {
1080      return lastAnnotation(null, type, filter);
1081   }
1082
1083   /**
1084    * Returns the last matching annotation on this class and superclasses/interfaces.
1085    *
1086    * <p>
1087    * Annotations are searched in the following orders:
1088    * <ol>
1089    *    <li>On this class.
1090    *    <li>On parent classes ordered child-to-parent.
1091    *    <li>On interfaces ordered child-to-parent.
1092    *    <li>On the package of this class.
1093    * </ol>
1094    *
1095    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1096    * @param annotationProvider The annotation provider.
1097    * @param type The annotation to look for.
1098    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if annotation should be returned.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1099    * @return This object.
1100    */
1101   public <A extends Annotation> A lastAnnotation(AnnotationProvider annotationProvider, Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter) {
1102      if (annotationProvider == null)
1103         annotationProvider = AnnotationProvider.DEFAULT;
1104      A x = null;
1105      ClassInfo[] parents = _getParents();
1106      for (ClassInfo parent : parents) {
1107         x = annotationProvider.lastAnnotation(type, parent.inner(), filter);
1108         if (x != null)
1109            return x;
1110      }
1111      ClassInfo[] interfaces = _getInterfaces();
1112      for (ClassInfo element : interfaces) {
1113         x = annotationProvider.lastAnnotation(type, element.inner(), filter);
1114         if (x != null)
1115            return x;
1116      }
1117      x = getPackageAnnotation(type);
1118      if (x != null && test(filter, x))
1119         return x;
1120      return null;
1121   }
1122
1123   /**
1124    * Finds the annotation of the specified type defined on this class or parent class/interface.
1125    *
1126    * <p>
1127    * If the annotation cannot be found on the immediate class, searches methods with the same
1128    * signature on the parent classes or interfaces.
1129    * <br>The search is performed in child-to-parent order.
1130    *
1131    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1132    * @param type The annotation to look for.
1133    * @return The annotation if found, or <jk>null</jk> if not.
1134    */
1135   public <A extends Annotation> A getAnnotation(Class<A> type) {
1136      return getAnnotation(null, type);
1137   }
1138
1139   /**
1140    * Finds the annotation of the specified type defined on this class or parent class/interface.
1141    *
1142    * <p>
1143    * If the annotation cannot be found on the immediate class, searches methods with the same signature on the parent classes or interfaces. <br>
1144    * The search is performed in child-to-parent order.
1145    *
1146    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1147    * @param annotationProvider The annotation provider.
1148    * @param type The annotation to look for.
1149    * @return The annotation if found, or <jk>null</jk> if not.
1150    */
1151   public <A extends Annotation> A getAnnotation(AnnotationProvider annotationProvider, Class<A> type) {
1152      return findAnnotation(annotationProvider, type);
1153   }
1154
1155   /**
1156    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has the specified annotation.
1157    *
1158    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1159    * @param type The annotation to look for.
1160    * @return The <jk>true</jk> if annotation if found.
1161    */
1162   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation(Class<A> type) {
1163      return hasAnnotation(null, type);
1164   }
1165
1166   /**
1167    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class doesn't have the specified annotation.
1168    *
1169    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1170    * @param type The annotation to look for.
1171    * @return The <jk>true</jk> if annotation if not found.
1172    */
1173   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasNoAnnotation(Class<A> type) {
1174      return ! hasAnnotation(type);
1175   }

1177   /**
1178    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has the specified annotation.
1179    *
1180    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1181    * @param annotationProvider The annotation provider.
1182    * @param type The annotation to look for.
1183    * @return The <jk>true</jk> if annotation if found.
1184    */
1185   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation(AnnotationProvider annotationProvider, Class<A> type) {
1186      if (annotationProvider == null)
1187         annotationProvider = AnnotationProvider.DEFAULT;
1188      return annotationProvider.firstAnnotation(type, c, x -> true) != null;
1189   }
1190
1191   /**
1192    * Returns the specified annotation only if it's been declared on the package of this class.
1193    *
1194    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1195    * @param type The annotation class.
1196    * @return The annotation, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
1197    */
1198   public <A extends Annotation> A getPackageAnnotation(Class<A> type) {
1199      Package p = c == null ? null : c.getPackage();
1200      return (p == null ? null : p.getAnnotation(type));
1201   }

1203   /**
1204    * Returns the first matching annotation of the specified type defined on the specified class or parent classes/interfaces in parent-to-child order.
1205    *
1206    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
1207    * @param type The annotation to look for.
1208    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1209    * @return This object.
1210    */
1211   public <A extends Annotation> A getAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter) {
1212      return getAnnotation(null, type, filter);
1213   }

1215   /**
1216    * Constructs an {@link AnnotationList} of all annotations found on this class.
1217    *
1218    * <p>
1219    * Annotations are appended in the following orders:
1220    * <ol>
1221    *    <li>On the package of this class.
1222    *    <li>On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
1223    *    <li>On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
1224    *    <li>On this class.
1225    * </ol>
1226    *
1227    * @return A new {@link AnnotationList} object on every call.
1228    */
1229   public AnnotationList getAnnotationList() {
1230      return getAnnotationList(x -> true);
1231   }
1232
1233   /**
1234    * Constructs an {@link AnnotationList} of all matching annotations on this class.
1235    *
1236    * <p>
1237    * Annotations are appended in the following orders:
1238    * <ol>
1239    *    <li>On the package of this class.
1240    *    <li>On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
1241    *    <li>On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
1242    *    <li>On this class.
1243    * </ol>
1244    *
1245    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if value should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1246    * @return A new {@link AnnotationList} object on every call.
1247    */
1248   public AnnotationList getAnnotationList(Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter) {
1249      AnnotationList l = new AnnotationList();
1250      forEachAnnotationInfo(filter, x -> l.add(x));
1251      return l;
1252   }
1253
1254   /*
1255    * If the annotation is an array of other annotations, returns the inner annotations.
1256    *
1257    * @param a The annotation to split if repeated.
1258    * @return The nested annotations, or a singleton array of the same annotation if it's not repeated.
1259    */
1260   private static Annotation[] splitRepeated(Annotation a) {
1261      try {
1262         ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(a.annotationType());
1263         MethodInfo mi = ci.getRepeatedAnnotationMethod();
1264         if (mi != null)
1265            return mi.invoke(a);
1266      } catch (Exception e) {
1267         e.printStackTrace();
1268      }
1269      return new Annotation[]{a};
1270   }
1271
1272   private <A extends Annotation> A findAnnotation(AnnotationProvider ap, Class<A> a) {
1273      if (a == null)
1274         return null;
1275      if (ap == null)
1276         ap = AnnotationProvider.DEFAULT;
1277      A t = ap.firstDeclaredAnnotation(a, c, x -> true);
1278      if (t != null)
1279         return t;
1280      ClassInfo sci = getSuperclass();
1281      if (sci != null) {
1282         t = sci.getAnnotation(ap, a);
1283         if (t != null)
1284            return t;
1285      }
1286      for (ClassInfo c2 : _getInterfaces()) {
1287         t = c2.getAnnotation(ap, a);
1288         if (t != null)
1289            return t;
1290      }
1291      return null;
1292   }
1293
1294   private <A extends Annotation> A getAnnotation(AnnotationProvider ap, Class<A> a, Predicate<A> filter) {
1295      if (ap == null)
1296         ap = AnnotationProvider.DEFAULT;
1297      A t2 = getPackageAnnotation(a);
1298      if (t2 != null && filter.test(t2))
1299         return t2;
1300      ClassInfo[] interfaces = _getInterfaces();
1301      for (int i = interfaces.length-1; i >= 0; i--) {
1302         A o = ap.firstDeclaredAnnotation(a, interfaces[i].inner(), filter);
1303         if (o != null)
1304            return o;
1305      }
1306      ClassInfo[] parents = _getParents();
1307      for (int i = parents.length-1; i >= 0; i--) {
1308         A o = ap.firstDeclaredAnnotation(a, parents[i].inner(), filter);
1309         if (o != null)
1310            return o;
1311      }
1312      return null;
1313   }
1314
1315   /**
1316    * Performs an action on all matching annotations on this class/parents/package.
1317    *
1318    * <p>
1319    * Annotations are consumed in the following order:
1320    * <ol>
1321    *    <li>On the package of this class.
1322    *    <li>On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
1323    *    <li>On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
1324    *    <li>On this class.
1325    * </ol>
1326    *
1327    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1328    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
1329    * @return This object.
1330    */
1331   public ClassInfo forEachAnnotationInfo(Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter, Consumer<AnnotationInfo<?>> action) {
1332      Package p = c.getPackage();
1333      if (p != null)
1334         for (Annotation a : p.getDeclaredAnnotations())
1335            for (Annotation a2 : splitRepeated(a))
1336               AnnotationInfo.of(p, a2).accept(filter, action);
1337      ClassInfo[] interfaces = _getInterfaces();
1338      for (int i = interfaces.length-1; i >= 0; i--)
1339         for (Annotation a : interfaces[i].c.getDeclaredAnnotations())
1340            for (Annotation a2 : splitRepeated(a))
1341               AnnotationInfo.of(interfaces[i], a2).accept(filter, action);
1342      ClassInfo[] parents = _getParents();
1343      for (int i = parents.length-1; i >= 0; i--)
1344         for (Annotation a : parents[i].c.getDeclaredAnnotations())
1345            for (Annotation a2 : splitRepeated(a))
1346               AnnotationInfo.of(parents[i], a2).accept(filter, action);
1347      return this;
1348   }
1349
1350   Annotation[] _getDeclaredAnnotations() {
1351      if (declaredAnnotations == null) {
1352         synchronized(this) {
1353            declaredAnnotations = c.getDeclaredAnnotations();
1354         }
1355      }
1356      return declaredAnnotations;
1357   }
1358
1359   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1360   // Characteristics
1361   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1362
1363   /**
1364    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if all specified flags are applicable to this class.
1365    *
1366    * @param flags The flags to test for.
1367    * @return <jk>true</jk> if all specified flags are applicable to this class.
1368    */
1369   public boolean isAll(ReflectFlags...flags) {
1370      for (ReflectFlags f : flags) {
1371         switch (f) {
1372            case DEPRECATED:
1373               if (isNotDeprecated())
1374                  return false;
1375               break;
1376            case NOT_DEPRECATED:
1377               if (isDeprecated())
1378                  return false;
1379               break;
1380            case PUBLIC:
1381               if (isNotPublic())
1382                  return false;
1383               break;
1384            case NOT_PUBLIC:
1385               if (isPublic())
1386                  return false;
1387               break;
1388            case STATIC:
1389               if (isNotStatic())
1390                  return false;
1391               break;
1392            case NOT_STATIC:
1393               if (isStatic())
1394                  return false;
1395               break;
1396            case MEMBER:
1397               if (isNotMemberClass())
1398                  return false;
1399               break;
1400            case NOT_MEMBER:
1401               if (isMemberClass())
1402                  return false;
1403               break;
1404            case ABSTRACT:
1405               if (isNotAbstract())
1406                  return false;
1407               break;
1408            case NOT_ABSTRACT:
1409               if (isAbstract())
1410                  return false;
1411               break;
1412            case INTERFACE:
1413               if (isClass())
1414                  return false;
1415               break;
1416            case CLASS:
1417               if (isInterface())
1418                  return false;
1419               break;
1420            default:
1421               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid flag for class: {0}", f);
1422
1423         }
1424      }
1425      return true;
1426   }
1427
1428   /**
1429    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if all specified flags are applicable to this class.
1430    *
1431    * @param flags The flags to test for.
1432    * @return <jk>true</jk> if all specified flags are applicable to this class.
1433    */
1434   public boolean isAny(ReflectFlags...flags) {
1435      for (ReflectFlags f : flags) {
1436         switch (f) {
1437            case DEPRECATED:
1438               if (isDeprecated())
1439                  return true;
1440               break;
1441            case NOT_DEPRECATED:
1442               if (isNotDeprecated())
1443                  return true;
1444               break;
1445            case PUBLIC:
1446               if (isPublic())
1447                  return true;
1448               break;
1449            case NOT_PUBLIC:
1450               if (isNotPublic())
1451                  return true;
1452               break;
1453            case STATIC:
1454               if (isStatic())
1455                  return true;
1456               break;
1457            case NOT_STATIC:
1458               if (isNotStatic())
1459                  return true;
1460               break;
1461            case MEMBER:
1462               if (isMemberClass())
1463                  return true;
1464               break;
1465            case NOT_MEMBER:
1466               if (isNotMemberClass())
1467                  return true;
1468               break;
1469            case ABSTRACT:
1470               if (isAbstract())
1471                  return true;
1472               break;
1473            case NOT_ABSTRACT:
1474               if (isNotAbstract())
1475                  return true;
1476               break;
1477            case INTERFACE:
1478               if (isInterface())
1479                  return true;
1480               break;
1481            case CLASS:
1482               if (isClass())
1483                  return true;
1484               break;
1485            default:
1486               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid flag for class: {0}", f);
1487         }
1488      }
1489      return false;
1490   }
1491
1492   /**
1493    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has the {@link Deprecated @Deprecated} annotation on it.
1494    *
1495    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class has the {@link Deprecated @Deprecated} annotation on it.
1496    */
1497   public boolean isDeprecated() {
1498      return c != null && c.isAnnotationPresent(Deprecated.class);
1499   }

1503    *

1505    */
1506   public boolean isNotDeprecated() {
1507      return c == null || ! c.isAnnotationPresent(Deprecated.class);
1508   }

1525      return c == null || ! Modifier.isPublic(c.getModifiers());
1526   }

1537      return c != null && Modifier.isStatic(c.getModifiers());

1689   /**
1690    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the {@link #getPrimitiveWrapper()} method returns a value.
1691    *
1692    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the {@link #getPrimitiveWrapper()} method returns a value.
1693    */
1694   public boolean hasPrimitiveWrapper() {
1695      return pmap1.containsKey(c);
1696   }
1697
1698   /**
1699    * If this class is a primitive (e.g. <code><jk>int</jk>.<jk>class</jk></code>) returns it's wrapper class
1700    * (e.g. <code>Integer.<jk>class</jk></code>).
1701    *
1702    * @return The wrapper class, or <jk>null</jk> if class is not a primitive.
1703    */
1704   public Class<?> getPrimitiveWrapper() {
1705      return pmap1.get(c);
1706   }
1707
1708   /**
1709    * If this class is a primitive wrapper (e.g. <code><jk>Integer</jk>.<jk>class</jk></code>) returns it's
1710    * primitive class (e.g. <code>int.<jk>class</jk></code>).
1711    *
1712    * @return The primitive class, or <jk>null</jk> if class is not a primitive wrapper.
1713    */
1714   public Class<?> getPrimitiveForWrapper() {
1715      return pmap2.get(c);
1716   }
1717
1718   /**
1719    * If this class is a primitive (e.g. <code><jk>int</jk>.<jk>class</jk></code>) returns it's wrapper class
1720    * (e.g. <code>Integer.<jk>class</jk></code>).
1721    *
1722    * @return The wrapper class if it's primitive, or the same class if class is not a primitive.
1723    */
1724   public Class<?> getWrapperIfPrimitive() {
1725      if (c != null && ! c.isPrimitive())
1726         return c;
1727      return pmap1.get(c);
1728   }
1729
1730   /**
1731    * Same as {@link #getWrapperIfPrimitive()} but wraps it in a {@link ClassInfo}.
1732    *
1733    * @return The wrapper class if it's primitive, or the same class if class is not a primitive.
1734    */
1735   public ClassInfo getWrapperInfoIfPrimitive() {
1736      if (c == null || ! c.isPrimitive())
1737         return this;
1738      return of(pmap1.get(c));
1739   }
1740
1741   /**
1742    * Returns the default value for this primitive class.
1743    *
1744    * @return The default value, or <jk>null</jk> if this is not a primitive class.
1745    */
1746   public Object getPrimitiveDefault() {
1747      return primitiveDefaultMap.get(c);
1748   }
1749
1750   private static final Map<Class<?>, Class<?>>
1751      pmap1 = new HashMap<>(),
1752      pmap2 = new HashMap<>();
1753   static {
1754      pmap1.put(boolean.class, Boolean.class);
1755      pmap1.put(byte.class, Byte.class);
1756      pmap1.put(short.class, Short.class);
1757      pmap1.put(char.class, Character.class);
1758      pmap1.put(int.class, Integer.class);
1759      pmap1.put(long.class, Long.class);
1760      pmap1.put(float.class, Float.class);
1761      pmap1.put(double.class, Double.class);
1762      pmap2.put(Boolean.class, boolean.class);
1763      pmap2.put(Byte.class, byte.class);
1764      pmap2.put(Short.class, short.class);
1765      pmap2.put(Character.class, char.class);
1766      pmap2.put(Integer.class, int.class);
1767      pmap2.put(Long.class, long.class);
1768      pmap2.put(Float.class, float.class);
1769      pmap2.put(Double.class, double.class);
1770   }
1771
1772   @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
1773   private static final Map<Class,Object> primitiveDefaultMap =
1774      mapBuilder(Class.class,Object.class).unmodifiable()
1775         .add(Boolean.TYPE, false)
1776         .add(Character.TYPE, (char)0)
1777         .add(Short.TYPE, (short)0)
1778         .add(Integer.TYPE, 0)
1779         .add(Long.TYPE, 0L)
1780         .add(Float.TYPE, 0f)
1781         .add(Double.TYPE, 0d)
1782         .add(Byte.TYPE, (byte)0)
1783         .add(Boolean.class, false)
1784         .add(Character.class, (char)0)
1785         .add(Short.class, (short)0)
1786         .add(Integer.class, 0)
1787         .add(Long.class, 0L)
1788         .add(Float.class, 0f)
1789         .add(Double.class, 0d)
1790         .add(Byte.class, (byte)0)
1791         .build();
1792
1793   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1794   // Labels
1795   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1796
1797   /**
1798    * Returns the full name of this class.
1799    *
1800    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
1801    * <ul>
1802    *    <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass"</js> - Normal class
1803    *    <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass[][]"</js> - Array.
1804    *    <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass$InnerClass"</js> - Inner class.
1805    *    <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass$InnerClass[][]"</js> - Inner class array.
1806    *    <li><js>"int"</js> - Primitive class.
1807    *    <li><js>"int[][]"</js> - Primitive class class.
1808    *    <li><js>"java.util.Map&lt;java.lang.String,java.lang.Object&gt;"</js> - Parameterized type.
1809    *    <li><js>"java.util.AbstractMap&lt;K,V&gt;"</js> - Parameterized generic type.
1810    *    <li><js>"V"</js> - Parameterized generic type argument.
1811    * </ul>
1812    *
1813    * @return The underlying class name.
1814    */
1815   public String getFullName() {
1816      Class<?> ct = getComponentType().inner();
1817      int dim = getDimensions();
1818      if (ct != null && dim == 0 && ! isParameterizedType)
1819         return ct.getName();
1820      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(128);
1821      appendFullName(sb);
1822      return sb.toString();
1823   }
1824
1825   /**
1826    * Returns all possible names for this class.
1827    *
1828    * @return
1829    *    An array consisting of:
1830    *    <ul>
1831    *       <li>{@link #getFullName()}
1832    *       <li>{@link Class#getName()} - Note that this might be a dup.
1833    *       <li>{@link #getShortName()}
1834    *       <li>{@link #getSimpleName()}
1835    *    </ul>
1836    */
1837   public String[] getNames() {
1838      return new String[]{ getFullName(), c.getName(), getShortName(), getSimpleName() };
1839   }
1840
1841   /**
1842    * Same as {@link #getFullName()} but appends to an existing string builder.
1843    *
1844    * @param sb The string builder to append to.
1845    * @return The same string builder.
1846    */
1847   public StringBuilder appendFullName(StringBuilder sb) {
1848      Class<?> ct = getComponentType().inner();
1849      int dim = getDimensions();
1850      if (ct != null && dim == 0 && ! isParameterizedType)
1851         return sb.append(ct.getName());
1852      sb.append(ct != null ? ct.getName() : t.getTypeName());
1853      if (isParameterizedType) {
1854         ParameterizedType pt = (ParameterizedType)t;
1855         sb.append('<');
1856         boolean first = true;
1857         for (Type t2 : pt.getActualTypeArguments()) {
1858            if (! first)
1859               sb.append(',');
1860            first = false;
1861            of(t2).appendFullName(sb);
1862         }
1863         sb.append('>');
1864      }
1865      for (int i = 0; i < dim; i++)
1866         sb.append('[').append(']');
1867      return sb;
1868   }
1869
1870   /**
1871    * Returns the short name of the underlying class.
1872    *
1873    * <p>
1874    * Similar to {@link #getSimpleName()} but also renders local or member class name prefixes.
1875    *
1876    * @return The short name of the underlying class.
1877    */
1878   public String getShortName() {
1879      Class<?> ct = getComponentType().inner();
1880      int dim = getDimensions();
1881      if (ct != null && dim == 0 && ! (isParameterizedType || isMemberClass() || c.isLocalClass()))
1882         return ct.getSimpleName();
1883      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(32);
1884      appendShortName(sb);
1885      return sb.toString();
1886   }
1887
1888   /**
1889    * Same as {@link #getShortName()} but appends to an existing string builder.
1890    *
1891    * @param sb The string builder to append to.
1892    * @return The same string builder.
1893    */
1894   public StringBuilder appendShortName(StringBuilder sb) {
1895      Class<?> ct = getComponentType().inner();
1896      int dim = getDimensions();
1897      if (ct != null) {
1898         if (ct.isLocalClass())
1899            sb.append(of(ct.getEnclosingClass()).getSimpleName()).append('$').append(ct.getSimpleName());
1900         else if (ct.isMemberClass())
1901            sb.append(of(ct.getDeclaringClass()).getSimpleName()).append('$').append(ct.getSimpleName());
1902         else
1903            sb.append(ct.getSimpleName());
1904      } else {
1905         sb.append(t.getTypeName());
1906      }
1907      if (isParameterizedType) {
1908         ParameterizedType pt = (ParameterizedType)t;
1909         sb.append('<');
1910         boolean first = true;
1911         for (Type t2 : pt.getActualTypeArguments()) {
1912            if (! first)
1913               sb.append(',');
1914            first = false;
1915            of(t2).appendShortName(sb);
1916         }
1917         sb.append('>');
1918      }
1919      for (int i = 0; i < dim; i++)
1920         sb.append('[').append(']');
1921      return sb;
1922   }
1923
1924   /**
1925    * Returns the simple name of the underlying class.
1926    *
1927    * <p>
1928    * Returns either {@link Class#getSimpleName()} or {@link Type#getTypeName()} depending on whether
1929    * this is a class or type.
1930    *
1931    * @return The simple name of the underlying class;
1932    */
1933   public String getSimpleName() {
1934      return c != null ? c.getSimpleName() : t.getTypeName();
1935   }
1936
1937   /**
1938    * Returns the name of the underlying class.
1939    *
1940    * @return The name of the underlying class.
1941    */
1942   public String getName() {
1943      return c != null ? c.getName() : t.getTypeName();
1944   }
1945
1946   /**
1947    * Same as {@link #getSimpleName()} but uses <js>"Array"</js> instead of <js>"[]"</js>.
1948    *
1949    * @return The readable name for this class.
1950    */
1951   public String getReadableName() {
1952      if (c == null)
1953         return t.getTypeName();
1954      if (! c.isArray())
1955         return c.getSimpleName();
1956      Class<?> c = this.c;
1957      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1958      while (c.isArray()) {
1959         sb.append("Array");
1960         c = c.getComponentType();
1961      }
1962      return c.getSimpleName() + sb;
1963   }
1964
1965   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1966   // Hierarchy
1967   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1968
1969   /**
1970    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>child</c>.
1971    *
1972    * @param child The child class.
1973    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>child</c>.
1974    */
1975   public boolean isParentOf(Class<?> child) {
1976      return c != null && child != null && c.isAssignableFrom(child);
1977   }
1978
1979   /**
1980    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>child</c>.
1981    *
1982    * <p>
1983    * Primitive classes are converted to wrapper classes and compared.
1984    *
1985    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
1986    * <p class='bjava'>
1987    *       ClassInfo.<jsm>of</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>).isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(String.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// true</jc>
1988    *       ClassInfo.<jsm>of</jsm>(CharSequence.<jk>class</jk>).isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(String.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// true</jc>
1989    *       ClassInfo.<jsm>of</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>).isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(CharSequence.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// false</jc>
1990    *       ClassInfo.<jsm>of</jsm>(<jk>int</jk>.<jk>class</jk>).isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(Integer.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// true</jc>
1991    *       ClassInfo.<jsm>of</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>).isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(<jk>int</jk>.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// true</jc>
1992    *       ClassInfo.<jsm>of</jsm>(Number.<jk>class</jk>).isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(<jk>int</jk>.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// true</jc>
1993    *       ClassInfo.<jsm>of</jsm>(<jk>int</jk>.<jk>class</jk>).isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(Number.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// false</jc>
1994    *       ClassInfo.<jsm>of</jsm>(<jk>int</jk>.<jk>class</jk>).isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(<jk>long</jk>.<jk>class</jk>);  <jc>// false</jc>
1995    * </p>
1996    *
1997    * @param child The child class.
1998    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>child</c>.
1999    */
2000   public boolean isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(Class<?> child) {
2001      if (c == null || child == null)
2002         return false;
2003      if (c.isAssignableFrom(child))
2004         return true;
2005      if (this.isPrimitive() || child.isPrimitive()) {
2006         return this.getWrapperIfPrimitive().isAssignableFrom(of(child).getWrapperIfPrimitive());
2007      }
2008      return false;
2009   }
2010
2011   /**
2012    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this type can be used as a parameter for the specified object.
2013    *
2014    * @param child The argument to check.
2015    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this type can be used as a parameter for the specified object.
2016    */
2017   public boolean canAcceptArg(Object child) {
2018      if (c == null || child == null)
2019         return false;
2020      if (c.isInstance(child))
2021         return true;
2022      if (this.isPrimitive() || child.getClass().isPrimitive()) {
2023         return this.getWrapperIfPrimitive().isAssignableFrom(of(child).getWrapperIfPrimitive());
2024      }
2025      return false;
2026   }
2027
2028   /**
2029    * Same as {@link #isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(Class)} but takes in a {@link ClassInfo}.
2030    *
2031    * @param child The child class.
2032    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>child</c>.
2033    */
2034   public boolean isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(ClassInfo child) {
2035      if (c == null || child == null)
2036         return false;
2037      if (c.isAssignableFrom(child.inner()))
2038         return true;
2039      if (this.isPrimitive() || child.isPrimitive()) {
2040         return this.getWrapperIfPrimitive().isAssignableFrom(child.getWrapperIfPrimitive());
2041      }
2042      return false;
2043   }
2044
2045   /**
2046    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>child</c>.
2047    *
2048    * @param child The child class.
2049    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>child</c>.
2050    */
2051   public boolean isParentOf(Type child) {
2052      if (child instanceof Class)
2053         return isParentOf((Class<?>)child);
2054      return false;
2055   }
2056
2057   /**
2058    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>child</c>.
2059    *
2060    * @param child The child class.
2061    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>child</c>.
2062    */
2063   public boolean isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives(Type child) {
2064      if (child instanceof Class)
2065         return isParentOfFuzzyPrimitives((Class<?>)child);
2066      return false;
2067   }

2069   /**
2070    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a child of <c>parent</c>.
2071    *
2072    * @param parent The parent class.
2073    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent of <c>child</c>.
2074    */
2075   public boolean isStrictChildOf(Class<?> parent) {
2076      return c != null && parent != null && parent.isAssignableFrom(c) && ! c.equals(parent);
2077   }
2078
2079   /**
2080    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a child or the same as <c>parent</c>.
2081    *
2082    * @param parent The parent class.
2083    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a child or the same as <c>parent</c>.
2084    */
2085   public boolean isChildOf(Class<?> parent) {
2086      return c != null && parent != null && parent.isAssignableFrom(c);
2087   }
2088
2089   /**
2090    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a child or the same as any of the <c>parents</c>.
2091    *
2092    * @param parents The parents class.
2093    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a child or the same as any of the <c>parents</c>.
2094    */
2095   public boolean isChildOfAny(Class<?>...parents) {
2096      for (Class<?> p : parents)
2097         if (isChildOf(p))
2098            return true;
2099      return false;
2100   }

2103    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a child or the same as <c>parent</c>.
2104    *
2105    * @param parent The parent class.
2106    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>parent</c>.
2107    */
2108   public boolean isChildOf(Type parent) {
2109      if (parent instanceof Class)
2110         return isChildOf((Class<?>)parent);
2111      return false;
2112   }

2115    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a child or the same as <c>parent</c>.
2116    *
2117    * @param parent The parent class.
2118    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a parent or the same as <c>parent</c>.
2119    */
2120   public boolean isChildOf(ClassInfo parent) {
2121      return isChildOf(parent.inner());
2122   }

2124   /**
2125    * Checks for equality with the specified class.
2126    *
2127    * @param c The class to check equality with.
2128    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified class is the same as this one.
2129    */
2130   public boolean is(Class<?> c) {
2131      return this.c != null && this.c.equals(c);
2132   }
2133
2134   /**
2135    * Checks for equality with the specified class.
2136    *
2137    * @param c The class to check equality with.
2138    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified class is the same as this one.
2139    */
2140   public boolean is(ClassInfo c) {
2141      if (this.c != null)
2142         return this.c.equals(c.inner());
2143      return t.equals(c.t);
2144   }

2147    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified value is an instance of this class.
2148    *
2149    * @param value The value to check.
2150    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified value is an instance of this class.
2151    */
2152   public boolean isInstance(Object value) {
2153      if (this.c != null)
2154         return c.isInstance(value);
2155      return false;
2156   }

2158   /**
2159    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is any of the specified types.
2160    *
2161    * @param types The types to check against.
2162    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is any of the specified types.
2163    */
2164   public boolean isAny(Class<?>...types) {
2165      for (Class<?> cc : types)
2166         if (is(cc))
2167            return true;
2168      return false;
2169   }

2176    */
2177   public boolean is(ReflectFlags...flags) {
2178      return isAll(flags);

2187      return c == null ? null : c.getPackage();

2192    *

2196      return getPackage() != null;

2199   /**
2200    * Returns the number of dimensions if this is an array type.
2201    *
2202    * @return The number of dimensions if this is an array type, or <c>0</c> if it is not.
2203    */
2204   public int getDimensions() {
2205      if (dim == -1) {
2206         int d = 0;
2207         Class<?> ct = c;
2208         while (ct != null && ct.isArray()) {
2209            d++;
2210            ct = ct.getComponentType();
2211         }
2212         this.dim = d;
2213         this.componentType = ct == c ? this : of(ct);
2214      }
2215      return dim;
2216   }
2217
2218   /**
2219    * Returns the base component type of this class if it's an array.
2220    *
2221    * @return The base component type of this class if it's an array, or this object if it's not.
2222    */
2223   public ClassInfo getComponentType() {
2224      if (componentType == null) {
2225         if (c == null)
2226            componentType = this;
2227         else
2228            getDimensions();
2229      }
2230      return componentType;
2231   }
2232
2233   /**
2234    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is an enum.
2235    *
2236    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is an enum.
2237    */
2238   public boolean isEnum() {
2239      return c != null && c.isEnum();
2240   }
2241
2242   /**
2243    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this is a repeated annotation class.
2244    *
2245    * <p>
2246    * A repeated annotation has a single <code>value()</code> method that returns an array
2247    * of annotations who themselves are marked with the {@link Repeatable @Repeatable} annotation
2248    * of this class.
2249    *
2250    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this is a repeated annotation class.
2251    */
2252   public boolean isRepeatedAnnotation() {
2253      if (isRepeatedAnnotation == null) {
2254         synchronized(this) {
2255            boolean b = false;
2256            repeatedAnnotationMethod = getPublicMethod(x -> x.hasName("value"));
2257            if (repeatedAnnotationMethod != null) {
2258               ClassInfo rt = repeatedAnnotationMethod.getReturnType();
2259               if (rt.isArray()) {
2260                  ClassInfo rct = rt.getComponentType();
2261                  if (rct.hasAnnotation(Repeatable.class)) {
2262                     Repeatable r = rct.getAnnotation(Repeatable.class);
2263                     b = r.value().equals(c);
2264                  }
2265               }
2266            }
2267            isRepeatedAnnotation = b;
2268         }
2269      }
2270      return isRepeatedAnnotation;
2271   }
2272
2273   /**
2274    * Returns the repeated annotation method on this class.
2275    *
2276    * <p>
2277    * The repeated annotation method is the <code>value()</code> method that returns an array
2278    * of annotations who themselves are marked with the {@link Repeatable @Repeatable} annotation
2279    * of this class.
2280    *
2281    * @return The repeated annotation method on this class, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
2282    */
2283   public MethodInfo getRepeatedAnnotationMethod() {
2284      if (isRepeatedAnnotation()) {
2285         if (repeatedAnnotationMethod == null) {
2286            synchronized(this) {
2287               repeatedAnnotationMethod = getPublicMethod(x -> x.hasName("value"));
2288            }
2289         }
2290         return repeatedAnnotationMethod;
2291      }
2292      return null;
2293   }

2299    */
2300   public boolean isArray() {
2301      return c != null && c.isArray();
2302   }

2309   public boolean isAnnotation() {
2310      return c != null && c.isAnnotation();

2315    *
2316    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a {@link Collection} or an array.
2317    */
2318   public boolean isCollectionOrArray() {
2319      return c != null && (Collection.class.isAssignableFrom(c) || c.isArray());
2320   }
